Package cosc202.andie

Class ImageAction

java.lang.Object
javax.swing.AbstractAction
cosc202.andie.ImageAction
All Implemented Interfaces:

Direct Known Subclasses:
ColourActions.BrightnessAndContrastAction, ColourActions.ConvertToGreyAction, EditActions.FlipHorizontalAction, EditActions.FlipVerticalAction, EditActions.RedoAction, EditActions.ResizeAction, EditActions.Rotate180Action, EditActions.RotateAntiClockwiseAction, EditActions.RotateClockwiseAction, EditActions.UndoAction, FileActions.FileExportAction, FileActions.FileOpenAction, FileActions.FileSaveAction, FileActions.FileSaveAsAction, FilterActions.GaussianFilterAction, FilterActions.MeanFilterAction, FilterActions.MedianFilterAction, FilterActions.SharpenFilterAction, FilterActions.SoftBlurAction, ViewActions.LanguageAction, ViewActions.ResizeWindowAction, ViewActions.ZoomFullAction, ViewActions.ZoomInAction, ViewActions.ZoomOutAction, ViewActions.ZoomToWindowAction
public abstract class ImageAction extends AbstractAction

Abstract class representing actions the user might take in the interface.

This class uses Java's AbstractAction approach for Actions that can be applied to images. The key difference from a generic AbstractAction is that an ImageAction contains a reference to an image (via an ImagePanel interface element).

A distinction should be made between an ImageAction and an ImageOperation. An ImageOperation is applied to an image in order to change it in some way. An ImageAction provides support for the user doing something to an image in the user interface. ImageActions may apply an ImageOperation, but do not have to do so.

CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

    • target

      protected static ImagePanel target
      The user interface element containing the image upon which actions should be performed. This is common to all ImageActions.
